Function.Description: The cmul function computes the product of its arguments.

Brief.Overview: The cmul function computes the product of its arguments. The arguments must be Character and the product returned as a Character . The operands are not checked and are not coerced. Both operands are treated as integers during the multiply operation.
Brief.Usage: The cmul built-in function is a simple but very fast character multiplication function. Use the cmul function for highly optimized character multiplication.

Argument.Name: char2
Argument.Note: An arbitrary number of character multiplier operands.

Syntax.Return: The product of all the boolean arguments expressed as a character.
